quest.name: A Welcome Guest
journal: Alphinaud looks just about ready to leave you behind.
objectives: Return to the Ocular at the Crystarium.
Speak with Beq Lugg at the Inn at Journey's Head.
Treat the patients with soul tonic.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We mustn't dally here any longer, Forename. If Beq Lugg is to hear the truth of our travails in the First, you of all people should be present.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Beq Lugg has a fine eye. Though we have yet to begin, I rather think the Exarch was right to call on them.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I sometimes forget we're not truly here in the First. It will be good to be whole again...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Did you happen to notice the magicked brooms strewn about the Grand Cosmos? Uncanny.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Fortunately for us, Beq Lugg is of a mind to see you and your fellow Scions justly compensated for your efforts.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: You have spun quite a tale. But tell me─have you given any thought as to how you might return to your world?

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: ...White auracite, you say? An intriguing proposition.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: But one which fails to account for the present state of your souls.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: They have become highly charged, likely as a consequence of having maintained tangible forms for so long. In such an energetic, unstable state, there is no telling what may happen to their souls within the auracite. They could very well become immutable to transference, never to be restored to their bodies.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Then...would it be possible to force our souls into a state of dormancy, prior to transference?

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: In theory, yes. But the soul is not a candle to be snuffed out and relit on a whim.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Well, that sounds ominous. What exactly would rendering our souls dormant entail?

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: In order to maintain a corporeal form, your souls constantly draw aether from your surroundings. This process must be halted, and the resulting surfeit of aether removed.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Your minds would ultimately be separated from these faux bodies of yours, rendering you incapable of interacting with the world around you. A cruel fate under normal circumstances, but one which will be rectified upon your return home.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Leaving lifeless husks... Like those poor souls at the Inn at Journey's Head─corrupted by the sin eaters, their aether made stagnant by the Light.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Corrupted? Stagnant...?

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Might I see these unfortunate individuals?

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Why? Do you think you might be able to help them?

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: I might...or I might not. But I shan't know for sure until I have seen their condition firsthand.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Then I would be glad to take you to them...on the understanding that you won't do anything which might increase their suffering.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: It was my faith in man I lost, not my compassion.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Well, I see no need for all of us to accompany you. While you escort our guest to the Inn, I will assist Urianger in creating the requisite auracite.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: I believe my talents would be better applied to that endeavor as well. Might I leave the three of you to assist Beq Lugg as necessary?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Let us make for Amh Araeng, then.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Urianger is more than capable of creating the auracite on his own, but if aught should go awry, I would be on hand to assist him.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: It pains me that there are those who yet suffer despite our victory over the Light. We must hope a way can be found to help both them and our friends.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Beq Lugg told me they wished to meet the worst afflicted. Halric... <sigh> There are times when I swear there's something he wants to tell me, if only he could form the words.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Having broken Light's stranglehold on the First, I would like to believe they will one day recover. Yet I fear that day may not come soon...

dialogue.name: HALRIC
dialogue.text: <mumble>

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: So this is Halric, is it? ...Yes, his aetheric balance leans perilously toward the Light.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Toward stasis...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: What do you suppose will happen to him?

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Not too bright, are you, boy? The same as all poor souls corrupted by the Light─he will become a sin eater.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: You don't know that. We've defeated the Wardens and banished the Light from the night sky. Halric was completely unresponsive before, but now...

dialogue.name: HALRIC
dialogue.text: ...<mumble>

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Then perhaps there is yet hope. Hmmm...

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: If I may, there is a treatment I wish to administer to the patients.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: What sort of treatment?

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: In the course of my studies of the soul, I once created a tonic which could temporarily stimulate the aether in one's body. After some refinement, it came to be used by the knights of Voeburt.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Then for far darker purposes...

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Lest it fall into the wrong hands, I swore never again to make it. But for their sakes, I will break that oath.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: It is not like to reverse the stagnation, mind you, but it should offer some measure of relief.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Please let this work...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Leave this one to me, Forename.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Come. Let us see what effect my tonic will have on their aether, if any.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Todden stares blankly at you. It would seem the tonic has had no effect.

dialogue.name: PAWNIL
dialogue.text: ...Hm? What is this...warmth I feel in my chest?

dialogue.name: VOYNE
dialogue.text: I...I feel...warm! And my legs, they...they don't feel as heavy...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Todden stares blankly at you. It would seem the tonic has had no effect.

dialogue.name: PAWNIL
dialogue.text: Strange... Is it me, or is it suddenly warmer? It feels rather nice.

dialogue.name: VOYNE
dialogue.text: Well, fancy that... My hands don't feel quite so stiff. Thank you, misssir.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Now then, have you noted any change in the patients?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: A notable rise in body temperature and increased motor function. In most of the patients, at least.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: The more severely afflicted show no response.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: As I feared, then.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: 'Tis true that with the restoration of night, the corrupting influence of Light will no longer grow. And yes, their bodies will naturally return to equilibrium given time...

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: But this holds true only for their corporeal aether. Their incorporeal aether─that of the soul─is not so easily mended.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Which is why those in the later stages of corruption─like Halric─appear unaffected by your tonic.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Precisely.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: The boy's soul is too far gone, his mind held together by the finest of threads.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: There is a chance he may one day recover, of course, but it could take years─decades, even.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: By the gods, he could wake to find himself an old man.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: A fine reward for his persistence... The opportunity to mourn the life he never had a chance to live.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: No, there must be something we can do.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Look, I realize this is not why we petitioned your aid, but do you think it possible we can find a way to hasten their recovery?

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: ...Maybe.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Nor do I think it impossible that in treating them, we might learn something of relevance to your own predicament...
